CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 3, 1970, pg. 1, reads: "NEWEST BLACK JUDGE - Atty. Henry R. Smith, State president of NAACP is sworn into office as the third Allegheny County Black Common Pleas Court Judge Monday by Common Pleas Court Judge Homer S. Brown, who became the country's first black judge in late 1950's and who was also at the time president of the Pittsburgh NAACP branch... - Harris Photo."Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 10, 1970, pg. 17, reads: "NEW PGH. JUDGE - Atty. Henry R. Smith, left state president of Pennsylvania NAACP Conference of branches in sword into office as a Common Pleas Court Judge of Allegheny County in Pittsburgh last week by veteran Common Pleas Court Judge Homer S. Brown, right is serving his second tern. Judge Warren Watson, who was elected in 1966, not shown, is the third black member of the 18-man Allegheny County Common Pleas Court bench."
TitMainTitle: Judge Homer S. Brown swearing in Atty. Henry Smith Jr. as Common Pleas Court Judge
